column4: hello, how can I hear my own mic in ubuntu 9.10? input levels go up when I speak, in sound preferences, but I cannot hear myself. thanks
why would you want this? you would get massive feedback
still I'd like to do it
in pulseaudio you can loop it round
install all the pulseaudio cack, padevchooser and freinds
it seems I've already have it installed, how can I configure it?
run it and look in your gnome panel
ok but it looks the same as the sound preferences panel I already have
yes but it is more powerful
ok, but how can I hear my own mic? it looks the same
mess about with your imput and output streams
I can only point you in the right direction for your crankpot schemes
